medical_history.chief_complaint: Brief episode of substernal chest pressure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The episode occurred while lifting a heavy object at home. The pressure was alleviated with a few minutes of rest. The patient had symptoms of dizziness and nosebleeding in the 3 weeks prior, along with increased shortness of breath over the past 6 months and morning cough.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prostate cancer (prostatectomy in 1995), controlled new-onset hypertension, history of ocular migraines, long-standing reflux, and constipation.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a heart attack at age 61, mother had dementia.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as a serviceman for a heating and air-conditioning company; exposed to asbestos 35 years prior; 50 pack-year smoking history (stopped 12 years ago); drinks an occasional glass of wine.
